column12: Reichweiten Erweiterung der Elektrofahrzeuge
column13: Einer der Besonderheiten dieses Patentes besteht darin,dass die Energieträger d.h. die Akkus in mehrere Segmente aufgeteilt werden können und sollten. Damit bei der Fortbewegung ein Teil des Batterie Segmentes die Energie für die Fortbewegung liefern kann und die anderen oder der andere Segment unabhängig geladet werden können!Und bei idealer Wahlweise der einzelnen Komponenten wäre es möglich genügent evtl. über den Bedarf hinaus für den Antrieb des Fahrzeuges Elektrische Energie zu erzeugen.Beim Abstellen des Fahrzeuges können dann die Überschüssig erzeugte Elektrische Energie aus den Batterien Segment entnommen werden was nicht für die Fortbewegung des Fahrzeuges benötigt wird und für andere Zwecke genutzt werden können wie z.B:es im Haushalt wieder eingespeist wird!

column12: ULTRA HIGH EFFICIENCY ORGANIC GEL MICROBIAL AIR FILTRATION AND PRODUCTION SYSTEM
column13: Disclosed is an air cleaner filter containing an improved organic gel, wherein an ultra-high efficiency organic gel microbial air (UGMA) filter cartridge has a nano-porous texture on organic gel in spongy carcass diameters of which are randomly distributed, randomly distributed organic gel in spongy carcass as microbial retainer generated by a layer covering inner surfaces of a spongy carcass having randomly distributed pores at the grade selected in the range of 0.5 mm to 2.5 mm according to need, air inlet channels that allow air to be passed into sandwich structure UGMA filter cartridge, air flow channels such that microbial loads smaller than 0.1 pm are retained by pores and the air wipes the nano-pores by generating micro turbulence therein. Also disclosed is a production method for manufacturing the UGMA filter.
column14: FILKIM FILTRE VE KIMYA SANAYI TICARET ANONIM SIRKETI

column12: BIOMIMETIC CODECS AND BIOMIMETIC CODING TECHNIQUES
column13: Examples of biomimetic codecs and biomimetic coding techniques are described herein. Morphologically-adaptive coding networks can be developed in accordance with energy dissipation driven “heat” generated by application of training data. The morphologically-adaptive coding networks may be representative of common features expected in an input signal or data stream. Decoding may proceed using the morphologically-adaptive coding network. Morphologically-adaptive coding networks may be used as a cortex that can be shared for boosting multimedia data compression rates and/or increasing the encode-decode fidelity of information content while the features remain queryable in encoded form. Examples of the biomimetic codecs and biomimetic coding techniques provide a broad-based technology platform that can be used in context-IDed multimedia storage, pattern recognition, and high-performance computing/big data management, the hallmarks of web- and cloud-based systems.
column15: SARIKAYA MEHMET;;USTUNDAG BURAK BERK

column12: Mobil geçiş ücretlendirme sistemi
column13: Mobil Geçiş Ücretlendirme Sistemi (MOGÜS), köprü, otoyol vb taşıt geçişlerinde veya aracın otopark, yıkama vb hizmet noktalarından çıkışında mevcut mobil (GSM, 3G, 4G vb) telefonuna ek bir cihaz gerektirmeyen bir ücretlendirme sistemidir. MOGÜS plaka kullanan kara taşıtlarında cep telefonu destekli bir abone kayıt ve ücretlendirme sistemi olup durup beklemeden otomatik geçişi sağlamaktadır.İllegal geçişleri tespit ederek bildirimini sağlayan bir denetim mekanizması vardır. Geçişlerde otomatik tanınan plaka ve araç tipine göre alınan veriler, aracın trafik tescil verileri, MOGÜS abonelik verileri, ilişkilendirilen telefonun abonelik verileri ve banka kayıt verileri ile beraber değerlendirildiği bir işlem sürecinden geçirilmektedir. MOGÜS ücretlendirmenin kredi kartı ya da bir banka hesabı üzerinden yapılmasını ve cep telefonu üzerinden raporlanmasını sağlamaktadır. MOGÜS'ün trafik sigorta denetimi de yapması ile trafiğe ilişkin diğer yasal yükümlülüklerin yerine getirilmesi aynı sistem üzerinden mümkün olmaktadır.

column12: OPERATION SCENARIO FLOW AND MECHANICAL MODELING AND ANALYSIS SYSTEM OF CARDIOVASCULAR REPAIR OPERATIONS FOR NEWBORN AND FOETUS
column13: This invention is related to an operation scenario flow, mechanical modeling and analysis system comprising web based, (i) growth (ii) scaling and (iii) quality control aimed, patient based fast prototyping functions, for newborn and fetus cardiovascular repair operations , developed in order to be used for training of doctors and patient specific post surgery performance prediction in hospitals following and prior to, cardiovascular operations within the field of bioengineering in the health sector. Moreover it can be used for both vivo implantation plans of patient specific cardiovascular devices (custom cardiac valve and cardiac support pumps) and adaptation of said devices to the physiology of the patient.

column12: ÇİFT AŞAMALI EMNİYET KEMERİ
column13: ÖZET Buluş; araçlarda kullanılan emniyet kemerlerinin tam ve doğru şekilde takılmasını sağlamak, kemerin sahte toka ile kullanılmasına, sürücü ve yolcuların kemeri arkalarından ya da koltuk arkasından geçirerek emniyet kemeri ikaz sistemlerinin yanıltılmasına engel olarak olası trafik kazalarındaki ölüm ve yaralanmaları en aza indirgemek ile ilgilidir. Çift aşamalı emniyet kemeri sistemi, üzerinde verici çip (2) bulunan emniyet kemeri tokası (1), içinde alıcı anten (4) bulunan emniyet kemeri kilit mekanizması (3), emniyet kemer kayışının (7) içine ince ve esnek yapıda yerleştirilmiş verici indüksiyon bobini (8) ve bunun karşı alıcısı olarak da koltuk döşeme kumaşının hemen altına yerleştirilmiş alıcı bobinlerden (9) (10) oluşmaktadır. Alıcı bobinler (9) (10) ve alıcı antenden (4) alınan sinyallere göre aşamaların herhangi ikisinden birinin doğrulanmaması halinde aracın elektronik kontrol ünitesindeki (6) hız limiti belirleyicisine ulaşarak araç hızının 20 km/h hızı geçmesine izin vermeyen mikro işlemci (5) içermektedir.

column12: SIMULTANEOUS MASS AND CAPACITANCE CHANGE MEASUREMENT FOR DEFINING NANOPARTICLES SUCH AS NANOPLASTIC, VIRUS, BY DETERMINING THEIR SIZE AND MATERIAL PROPERTIES AT THE PARTICLE LEVEL
column13: The present invention relates to an analyzer and method for simultaneously determining both size and material properties of a single nanoparticle. In the present invention, both the mass of the nanoparticle and the change in capacitance induced on a capacitive sensor by the nanoparticle are measured simultaneously, and thus the size and material properties of the nanoparticle are determined. An analyzer for simultaneously determining the size and material properties of a nanoparticle is described with the present invention, this device comprises a mass sensor, a capacitor sensor and a common precise measurement region of the mass sensor and capacitor sensor, wherein said mass sensor and capacitor sensor provide common measurement. The present invention can be used in the field of biomedical, environmental engineering and materials engineering.

column12: METHODS AND COMPOSITIONS FOR PRESERVING TISSUES AND ORGANS
column13: The present invention generally relates to methods and compositions to determine viability of an organ for transplantation and other medical purposes. One aspect of the invention relates to a method for assessing the viability of an organ by measuring the energy parameters to determine the energy level of the organ by determining the stored cellular energy (e.g., ATP levels), and/or energy consumption over a particular time period of viability. The energy parameters can be compared to reference energy parameters as a highly accurate and reliable prediction of viable cell yield, and organ viability. Another aspect of the invention relates methods to preserve or extend the time period of viability of an organ any combination of (i) preservation perfusion of the organ to prevent ischemic damage, (ii) chemical metabolic suppression of the organ e.g., using metabolic suppressants, (iii) metabolic suppression by physical or environmental conditions, e.g., sub-zero non-freezing storage.

column13: The present invention generally relates to methods and compositions to determine viability of an organ for transplantation and other medical purposes. One aspect of the invention relates to a method for assessing the viability of an organ by measuring the energy parameters to determine the energy level of the organ by determining the stored cellular energy (e.g., ATP levels), and/or energy consumption over a particular time period of viability. The energy parameters can be compared to reference energy parameters as a highly accurate and reliable prediction of viable cell yield, and organ viability. Another aspect of the invention relates methods to preserve or extend the time period of viability of an organ any combination of (i) preservation perfusion of the organ to prevent ischemic damage, (ii) chemical metabolic suppression of the organ e.g., using metabolic suppressants, (iii) metabolic suppression by physical or environmental conditions, e.g., sub-zero non-freezing storage.

Another aspect of the invention relates methods to preserve or extend the time period of viability of an organ any combination of (i) preservation perfusion of the organ to prevent ischemic damage, (ii) chemical metabolic suppression of the organ e.g., using metabolic suppressants, (iii) metabolic suppression by physical or environmental conditions, e.g., sub-zero non-freezing storage.

column12: METHODS AND COMPOSITIONS FOR PRESERVING TISSUES AND ORGANS
column13: The present invention generally relates to methods and compositions to determine viability of an organ for transplantation and other medical purposes. One aspect of the invention relates to a method for assessing the viability of an organ by measuring the energy parameters to determine the energy level of the organ by determining the stored cellular energy (e.g., ATP levels), and/or energy consumption over a particular time period of viability. The energy parameters can be compared to reference energy parameters as a highly accurate and reliable prediction of viable cell yield, and organ viability. Another aspect of the invention relates methods to preserve or extend the time period of viability of an organ any combination of (i) preservation perfusion of the organ to prevent ischemic damage, (ii) chemical metabolic suppression of the organ e.g., using metabolic suppressants, (iii) metabolic suppression by physical or environmental conditions, e.g., sub-zero non-freezing storage.

One aspect of the invention relates to a method for assessing the viability of an organ by measuring the energy parameters to determine the energy level of the organ by determining the stored cellular energy (e.g., ATP levels), and/or energy consumption over a particular time period of viability. The energy parameters can be compared to reference energy parameters as a highly accurate and reliable prediction of viable cell yield, and organ viability. Another aspect of the invention relates methods to preserve or extend the time period of viability of an organ any combination of (i) preservation perfusion of the organ to prevent ischemic damage, (ii) chemical metabolic suppression of the organ e.g., using metabolic suppressants, (iii) metabolic suppression by physical or environmental conditions, e.g., sub-zero non-freezing storage.

column12: MEDİKAL ÜRÜN TAŞIMACILIĞINDA KULLANILMAK ÜZERE BİR İNSANSIZ HAVA ARACI VE KULLANILDIĞI SİSTEM
column13: Buluş, başta her türlü ilaç ve ilk yardım malzemeleri gibi acil ihtiyaç duyulan medikal ürünlerin taşımacılığında kullanılmak üzere, her türlü küçük boyuttaki parçaların taşınmasında kullanılabilen insansız hava aracı ve bu hava aracının kullanıldığı bir sistem ile ilgilidir
